revised_title: Observations on the Connection between Winds and Barometer Movements in the St. Lawrence River Valley
tldr: The author, William Kelly, presents a study of the relationship between winds and barometer movements in the St. Lawrence River Valley. He found that the barometer often rises as well as falls under the influence of strong winds, and that the winds can blow with greater force with a rising barometer. This study contributes to the understanding of how weather phenomena, such as wind and atmospheric pressure, are interconnected.
